alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 13 at 2:04AM AKST until November 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Through 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Water will inundate low lying areas and may impact some structures near the shoreline. Low lying roads and trails may be flooded. Large breaking waves will cause shoreline erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Elevated water levels 2 to 4 feet above the normal high tide line are expected. Waves will push onshore, especially along south and west facing shores. Peak water levels will occur Monday into Monday night. Sustained southwest winds 25 to 35 mph will shift to the northwest Monday night.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
